Class Vector

java.lang.Object
algebra.Vector
public class Vector extends Object
Class that represents a numeric vector.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Vector(double[] components)
    Constructs a vector with the given array of components.
    Vector(int dimension)
    Constructs a vector with the given dimension, initialized to zeros.

  • Constructor Details

    • Vector

      public Vector(int dimension)
      Constructs a vector with the given dimension, initialized to zeros.
      Parameters:
      dimension - Number of components.

    • Vector

      public Vector(double[] components)
      Constructs a vector with the given array of components.
      Parameters:
      components - Array of component values.

  • Method Details

    • getDimension

      public int getDimension()
      Returns the dimension of the vector.
      Returns:
      The number of components.

    • getComponent

      public double getComponent(int index)
      Returns the i-th component of the vector.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the component.
      Returns:
      Value at the index.

    • setComponent

      public void setComponent(int index, double value)
      Sets the value of the i-th component.
      Parameters:
      index - Index to set.
      value - Value to assign.

    • dotProduct

      public double dotProduct(Vector other)
      Returns the dot product of this vector and another.
      Parameters:
      other - The other vector.
      Returns:
      The dot product result.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If dimensions don't match.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the vector components to the console.

    • toCsvLine

      public String toCsvLine()
      Converts the vector to a comma-separated string (e.g., "1.0,2.0,3.0").
      Returns:
      CSV-style string of the vector.

    • write

      public void write(String fileName) throws IOException
      Writes the vector components to a plain text file, with components separated by commas.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the .txt file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • readFromInput

      public static Vector readFromInput(Scanner scanner, int dimension)
      Reads a vector of given dimension from user input.
      Parameters:
      scanner - Scanner instance.
      dimension - Number of components.
      Returns:
      A new vector with user input values.
